alternatives.transcript: Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home. We love chicken at our house and very often I cook the thigh. Sometimes the breast, thin slice, just sauté briefly, but the thigh for me is 1 of the best part. I have 2 large thigh of chicken here with the skin on. And I'm gonna show you a way I'm doing it. So I put it upside down as you see here and I cut around the bone here. I cut to expose the bone. That will help in the cooking. You see the bone is kind of exposed here. Here, and that's it. So on top of this, I'm gonna put salt, pepper, A little bit on the other side. And I started skin side down in a nonstick skillet here. No fat, nothing in it. There is enough fat coming out of the skin to do the whole dish. So what I'm going to do here, Let brown 2, 3 minutes on high heat. Then I will cover it. Right, I have a nice lid here, cover it and cook it about 20 minutes at low heat. So there will be enough steam coming out of the chicken because it's covered to cook the top. So I do not turn the chicken. I leave it like that and the screen will be very crispy. Well, it's close to 20 minutes now. So we continue, I have a bit of garlic here and some spinach. And that's what we're going to do other garnish. So I take the stem out of the, okay, this is 20 minutes. And as you can see now, yeah, it's pretty tender, quite tender and the outside is of course, beautifully brown. So I leave it a couple of more minutes while I crush my garlic. Crush the garlic each time so that remove the skin, you see. Now I crush it. You can put some shallots in it, another thing, but I like garlic with the spinach. This is 2 large thigh of chicken, 2 people. Those are baby spinach, all nice and clean. So this is about 4 ounces, but it kind of diminish when you cook it. So let's see now. We'll take those things out. Beautifully crusty. And now I have all the gripping in there. And that's what we're gonna put the, remember I didn't put any fat in it, just the fat of the chicken came out. I leave you with that garlic. I shake it this way. And I'm ready to put the spinach in there. Okay. Those are dry spinach. So I'm gonna put like a couple of tablespoon of water here just to start the steaming process and I cover it and that will cook in like 1, 2 minute. So let's see my spinach here. A little bit of salt in there. Pepper. That's it, and another minute of cooking, and that's about it. As you can see, just a tablespoon of water or so, it's half the process of steaming. And that's about it for my wife and me. The spinach and the breast on top of it. And this is the end. Beautiful chicken thigh with spinach. Great dinner for tonight. Love to cook for you. Happy cooking!

paragraphs.transcript:
Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home. We love chicken at our house and very often I cook the thigh. Sometimes the breast, thin slice, just sauté briefly, but the thigh for me is 1 of the best part. I have 2 large thigh of chicken here with the skin on. And I'm gonna show you a way I'm doing it.

So I put it upside down as you see here and I cut around the bone here. I cut to expose the bone. That will help in the cooking. You see the bone is kind of exposed here. Here, and that's it.

So on top of this, I'm gonna put salt, pepper, A little bit on the other side. And I started skin side down in a nonstick skillet here. No fat, nothing in it. There is enough fat coming out of the skin to do the whole dish. So what I'm going to do here, Let brown 2, 3 minutes on high heat.

Then I will cover it. Right, I have a nice lid here, cover it and cook it about 20 minutes at low heat. So there will be enough steam coming out of the chicken because it's covered to cook the top. So I do not turn the chicken. I leave it like that and the screen will be very crispy.

Well, it's close to 20 minutes now. So we continue, I have a bit of garlic here and some spinach. And that's what we're going to do other garnish. So I take the stem out of the, okay, this is 20 minutes. And as you can see now, yeah, it's pretty tender, quite tender and the outside is of course, beautifully brown.

So I leave it a couple of more minutes while I crush my garlic. Crush the garlic each time so that remove the skin, you see. Now I crush it. You can put some shallots in it, another thing, but I like garlic with the spinach. This is 2 large thigh of chicken, 2 people.

Those are baby spinach, all nice and clean. So this is about 4 ounces, but it kind of diminish when you cook it. So let's see now. We'll take those things out. Beautifully crusty.

And now I have all the gripping in there. And that's what we're gonna put the, remember I didn't put any fat in it, just the fat of the chicken came out. I leave you with that garlic. I shake it this way. And I'm ready to put the spinach in there.

Okay. Those are dry spinach. So I'm gonna put like a couple of tablespoon of water here just to start the steaming process and I cover it and that will cook in like 1, 2 minute. So let's see my spinach here. A little bit of salt in there.

Pepper. That's it, and another minute of cooking, and that's about it. As you can see, just a tablespoon of water or so, it's half the process of steaming. And that's about it for my wife and me. The spinach and the breast on top of it.

And this is the end. Beautiful chicken thigh with spinach. Great dinner for tonight. Love to cook for you. Happy cooking!
